<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/a28639e71198238d5c09c43445dc448d7f3fb29b|patch 8.2.2377: Vim9: crash when using a range after another expression>
patch 8.2.2377: Vim9: crash when using a range after another expression

Problem:    Vim9: crash when using a range after another expression.
Solution:   Set the variable type to number. Fix using :put with a range and
            the "=" register. (closes #7706)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2377: Vim9: crash when using a range after another expression · vim/vim@a28639e
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2377: Vim9: crash when using a range after another expression · vim/vim@a28639e
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: crash when using a range after another expression. Solution: Set the variable type to number. Fix using :put with a range and the "=" register. (closes #7706)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/e64f83cc6aba05baa61ba4a4cb8d4447b8091e5b|patch 8.2.2376: Vim9: crash when dividing by zero in compiled code>
patch 8.2.2376: Vim9: crash when dividing by zero in compiled code

Problem:    Vim9: crash when dividing by zero in compiled code using
            constants.
Solution:   Call num_divide() and num_modulus(). (closes #7704)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2376: Vim9: crash when dividing by zero in compiled code · vim/vim@e64f83c
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2376: Vim9: crash when dividing by zero in compiled code · vim/vim@e64f83c
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: crash when dividing by zero in compiled code using constants. Solution: Call num_divide() and num_modulus(). (closes #7704)

patch 8.2.2375: test for RGB color skipped in the terminal

Solution:   Run the GUI if possible.
